com.ephesoft.gxt.core.server.util

Class RequestUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ephesoft.gxt.core.server.util.RequestUtil

  • public class RequestUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for retrieving and setting data in session and request. The utility method provided automatically casts session and request attributes to the required type.

      Following utilities have been provided:-
    • Check for the existence of session variable.
    • Fetch session and request attribute in many ways as follows:-
      • Directly fetch object of any type, e.g , T objectOfTypeT = RequestUtil.getSessionAttribute(request, key) ;
      • Get list of any type of object, e.g List listOfTypeT = RequestUtil.getSessionListAttribute(request, key);
      • Get set of any type of object.
      • Get map of any type of object.
    • Set session and request attributes.
      Version:
      $LastChangedDate:$
      $LastChangedRevision:$
      Author:
      Ephesoft created on 18-Nov-2013

      • Method Detail

        • isSessionAttribute

          public static boolean isSessionAttribute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest,
                         java.lang.String attributeKey)
          Checks the existence of the given session variable.

          In case if any parameter provided is NULL, false is returned otherwise according to the availability.

          Parameters:
          httpServletRequest - HttpServletRequest request attribute from which session variable needs to be checked.
          attributeKey - String Key of the attribute in session.
          Returns:
          true/false.

        • getSessionAttribute

          public static <T> T getSessionAttribute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest,
                        java.lang.String attributeKey)
          Gets the session attribute from the session by checking if the given attribute is available. It automatically cast the session attributes according to the type needed.

          In case attribute is not present or any parameter provided is NULL , it returns NULL .

          In case the type to be returned is not compatible or not correct with the session attribute, corresponding exception is logged and NULL is returned.

          Type Parameters:
          T - type of session object to be returned.
          Parameters:
          httpServletRequest - HttpServletRequest request attribute from which session variable needs to fetched.
          attributeKey - String Key of the attribute in session.
          Returns:
          session attribute of the given type or NULL in above mentioned cases.

          Parameters:

          session map attribute of the given type or NULL in above mentioned cases.

        • setSessionAttribute

          public static void setSessionAttribute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest,
                       java.lang.String attributeKey,
                       java.lang.Object attributeValue)
          Sets the attribute provided in the request session.

          Attribute is not set in session in case the parameters provided are NULL.

          Parameters:
          httpServletRequest - HttpServletRequest request in which attribute needs to be set in the session.
          attributeKey - String attribute key.
          attributeValue - Object attribute value.

        • getAttributeFromHeader

          public static java.lang.String getAttributeFromHeader(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest,
                                      java.lang.String headerName)
          Gets the header value for the header name passed from the given request.

          In case any parameters provide are NULL, it returns NULL as header value.

          Parameters:
          httpServletRequest - HttpServletRequest request from which header value needs to be fetched.
          headerName - String header name for the header value.
          Returns:
          header vale for the given parameters.

        • getRequestAttribute

          public static <T> T getRequestAttribute(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpServletRequest,
                        java.lang.String attributeKey)
          Gets the request attribute from the session by checking if the given attribute is available. It automatically cast the request attributes according to the type needed.

          In case attribute is not present or any parameter provided is NULL , it returns NULL .

          In case the type to be returned is not compatible or not correct with the request attribute, corresponding exception is logged and NULL is returned.

          Type Parameters:
          T - type of request object to be returned.
          Parameters:
          httpServletRequest - HttpServletRequest request attribute from which request variable needs to fetched.
          attributeKey - String Key of the attribute in request.
          Returns:
          request attribute of the given type or NULL in above mentioned cases.
